conclusion: The light source is initially positioned above the objects.
The objects (A, B, C, and D) are initially positioned on the ground.
As the light source moves forward, it will cast shadows on the ground.
The size and position of the shadows will change as the light source moves forward.
The larger the shadow, the further the light source is from the objects.
The smaller the shadow, the closer the light source is to the objects.
The shadow of Object A will become smaller and move closer to the light source as the light source moves forward.
The shadow of Object B will become larger and move further away from the light source as the light source moves forward.
The shadow of Object C will remain relatively unchanged in size and position as the light source moves forward.
The shadow of Object D will remain relatively unchanged in size and position as the light source moves forward.
Object A's shadow will be smaller and closer to the light source.
Object B's shadow will be larger and further away from the light source.
Object C's shadow remains relatively unchanged.
Object D's shadow remains relatively unchanged.
